metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14222 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
In libavformat/mov.c in FFmpeg 3.3.3, a DoS in read_tfra() due to lack of an EOF (End of File) check might cause huge CPU and memory consumption. When a crafted MOV file, which claims a large "item_count" field in the header but does not contain sufficient backing data, is provided, the loop would consume huge CPU and memory resources, since there is no EOF check inside the loop.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14222` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
